name: Mayne Island Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the MAyne Island Resort or more precisely checked in but never spent the night. Although the picture of the photograph are accurate, they really fail to communicate just how small the rooms are. Granted you are on a Gulf Island (very similar to the San Jaun islands near Seattle) but still ...
reviews.title: There Are (Much) Better Choices Out There
Rooms too small
reviews.text: It's hard to convey just how samll the rooms are; think a European B&B where you must step out to change your mind. The bathroom is also tiny and don't even dream of anything better than a queen size bed! For your climate conrol comfort, there is a small plastic fan. The balconies do have a wonderful ocean view and the property is ocean front but even these charms do not make up for the deficiencies in the room - we were shocked to find a "commmunal" bar fridge in the hallway - jam packed with numerous, various beverage containers. If you've ever been perturbed with the bar fridges in econo-chain motels this place will cure you of it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is okay but be warned, it does not open for breakfast. The prices were okay but it is more a road-house menu than what one would expect in a small island resort n the great Pacific North-West.
reviews.title: beautiful view

reviews.text: So long story short, we decided that our suburban home was way more attractive and comfortable this place. I'm sure it will be fine for some travellers but for those used to a bit of luxury and pampering on your trip, I would strongly suggest you keep looking.
reviews.title: Fantastic getaway for our little family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will we be back? No.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I decided to stay in one of the cottages since some reviews said the rooms were small and I wanted my visit to be a memorable one, since I'm celebrating my bf's belated birthday. Overall, if you stay at one of the cottages, you will find everything you need. I brought extra face cloths and towels as I read there would be no maid service during your stay. The face cloths came in handy, though I didn't really need my extra towels. I noticed they did have two spare bath towels in the closet (as the cottages can sleep 4) so I think this is the reason. However, since we were a couple, there were only 2 bathrobes. You will need to bring extra shampoo. They do provide bath soap and there is a hairdryer.
reviews.title: Surprised in more ways than one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in - We were able to check in early in so you should try to, as well. We arrived by 10 am morning ferry from Vancouver but didn't try to check in earlier because we thought 10 am was way too early. After lunch , we drove around a bit then decided to drop by around 2 pm to try our luck. They advised that the room was ready at 10 am, since no one stayed the night before and they knew the ferry would arrive at 10 am. So I recommend that you can drop by earlier to see if you can check in early.
reviews.title: Perfect Couples' Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have a golf cart which they use to drive you to your room (complimentary). The distance is not far - maybe 100 feet away, so you could wheel your luggage but only 3/4 of the path is paved, and rest is gravel.
reviews.title: Great gateway place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check in, you pay for the balance of your stay eg. if you are reserved for a 2 night stay, you pay for the balance at check in.
reviews.title: Fantastic couple's retreat on Bennett Bay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out: there is a box outside the front door where you can drop off your room key card when you leave, handy if you are taking the 7:30 am ferry .. or I suppose you could also leave the keys in the room.
reviews.title: Love this resort for its privacy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent last week of June in an amazing first-class cottage and location. Staff are to be commended for their professionalism, friendly demeanor and ensuring what will now become a regular visit to Mayne Island. Resort services are top notch including grocery store only 4 km away. We are kayakers and this resort offers a front row seat to some of this best experiences on the West Coast where after a day on the water you can retreat to the spa, excellent restaurant, and finally a glass of wine at your private cottage over looking the amazing scenery and wildlife. To all at Mayne Island Resort, thank you very much for a superb experience and have a great 2013 season. See you soon, Walt & Pam (#111)
reviews.title: "West Coast Island Beauty"

reviews.text: We recently visited Mayne Island Resort and spent a week in one of the cottages overlooking the ocean. It is the most awesome view ever. The cottage is very nice and comfortable. It has everything that you need and it is very well maintained. There is a great restaurant at the resort as well as a wine store. The hot tub and pool are very welcoming and a great way to spend some time. This is a great place to come to if you want to just relax and enjoy the stillness and beauty around you. However, there is also much to do there as well, such as kayaking, hiking and exploring.
reviews.title: Peaceful and quiet

reviews.text: The staff and personnel are very friendly and are always there for you to make your stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: This is a very relaxing, quiet and enjoyable place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a great time when I spent a week in Mayne Island resort over looking the Bennett Bay last year May 2012. Beautify secenic place, friendly staff, fantastic restaurant, wine store and spa services available. All the amenities I need for a relaxing get away. There are lots of scenic hiking trails to choose from or sitting on the beach just to relax. I loved the well maintained tennis courts near the community center. Great place to visit again.
reviews.title: Beautiful place for a relaxing and peaceful time away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband was celebrating a significant birthday and we chose this lovely island for a few days away.
reviews.title: Fantastic view but stay in a cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in one of the standard queen rooms. The size of the room was adequate for a short stay with a nice view right outside our window, and the price was decent, for those on a bit more of a budget, but wanting something comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice weekend getaway
